Jokingly calls out Peter for supposedly trying to put moves on his mom, showing protective behavior.
Takes a role of looking out for his mother, indicating trustworthiness and caring nature.
Explains the Battlestar Galactica wrist watch confidently to Amy, showing his familiarity and comfort with his interests.
Offers to help Peter at the bar and engages in social interaction smoothly, demonstrating social competence.
Jokingly calls out Peter for trying to put moves on his mom, indicating awareness and protective instinct.
Starts to correct Peter about vampires not showing on film, showing knowledge but is interrupted.
Expresses skepticism about exploiting supernatural phenomena for profit and suggests focusing on saving people from evil instead.
Shows sympathy and concern when noticing a fearful, ghostly reflection of Ed, indicating sensitivity.
Catches a suspicious, eerie reflection signaling potential danger and reacts by being spooked but stays observant.
Questions Peter's focus on performing an act instead of prioritizing saving people from evil, showing moral clarity but some distraction from immediate practical action.

Ed.Action: Grips the stake and challenges Jerry despite fear and despair, insisting 'I know my shit' and daring Jerry to try him.
Momentarily loses conviction and lowers stake slightly after Jerry's psychological manipulation.
Keeps fighting emotional pain and refuses Jerry's tempting offer to end it all, showing resilience.

Charlie Brewster.Action: Looks in the small prison rooms despite danger, shows concern for Doris.
Attempts to open the locked door to free Doris.
Tells Doris 'I won't leave you' despite inability to help her immediately.
Hides quietly rather than confront Jerry or try to escape immediately.
Recognizes immediate danger and insists on taking decisive action to protect himself and others, demonstrating situational awareness and resolve.
Looks around carefully for the threat while driving, showing vigilance and awareness of his environment.
Stops the car after threat appears, suggesting responsible and quick reaction to an emerging situation.
Does not panic despite the extreme threat (Jerry ramming from under the car), maintaining composure to some extent.
Does not appear to communicate a detailed plan or seek additional help proactively, only urgent commands and concern.
